alert.note: Alert for Beaverhead and Western Madison below 6000ft (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 21 at 9:04AM MST until December 21 at 3:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 PM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. * WHERE...Beaverhead and Western Madison below 6000ft. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 3 PM MST this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Warning, from Noon today to 6 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Whiteout conditions are expected and will make travel treacherous and potentially life-threatening. Plan on slippery road conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Exposed skin may become quickly frostbitten or frozen.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
